definition.text:
1. To correct by punishing; to punish; to inflict pain by stripes, or in other manner, for the purpose of punishing an offender and recalling him to his duty.I will chastise you seven times for your sins. Leviticus 2 6:2
8.
2. To reduce to order or obedience; to restrain; to awe; to repress.The gay social sense, By decency chastisd.
3. To correct; to purify by expunging faults; as, to chastise a poem.
